trans-unit.source: Azure Virtual Network Configuration Schema
trans-unit.target: Azure Virtual Network Configuration Schema

trans-unit.source: Azure Virtual Network Configuration Schema
trans-unit.target: Azure Virtual Network Configuration Schema

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>VirtualNetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element of the Virtual Network configuration schema specifies Virtual Network configuration settings.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>VirtualNetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element of the Virtual Network configuration schema specifies Virtual Network configuration settings.

trans-unit.source: VirtualNetworkConfiguration Element
trans-unit.target: VirtualNetworkConfiguration Element

trans-unit.source: The following example shows the <languageKeyword>VirtualNetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element and its child elements.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows the <languageKeyword>VirtualNetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element and its child elements.

trans-unit.source: The example below shows the VirtualNetworkSite element with both the AffinityGroup attribute and the Location attribute.
trans-unit.target: The example below shows the VirtualNetworkSite element with both the AffinityGroup attribute and the Location attribute.

trans-unit.source: Only one can be defined for a virtual network site.
trans-unit.target: Only one can be defined for a virtual network site.

trans-unit.source: Either a virtual network site can be in an affinity group, or located in a specified location.
trans-unit.target: Either a virtual network site can be in an affinity group, or located in a specified location.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that Location be used whenever possible.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that Location be used whenever possible.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the child elements of the <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the child elements of the <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: Element
trans-unit.target: Element

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: DnsServer
trans-unit.target: DnsServer

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a DNS server for the Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a DNS server for the Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: You can specify up to 9 DNS servers.
trans-unit.target: You can specify up to 9 DNS servers.

trans-unit.source: The name of the DNS server is defined as a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the DNS server is defined as a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: The IP address of the DNS server is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>IPAddress</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The IP address of the DNS server is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>IPAddress</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify a DNS server, Azure will default to using its own DNS service.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify a DNS server, Azure will default to using its own DNS service.

trans-unit.source: DNS server names must be uniquely identifiable within the subscription.
trans-unit.target: DNS server names must be uniquely identifiable within the subscription.

trans-unit.source: After the DNS servers have been specified and the network configuration file has been uploaded to Azure, you cannot update or add DNS server names or IP addresses once a virtual machine or cloud service has been deployed to the Virtual Network, regardless of whether or not the service is running.
trans-unit.target: After the DNS servers have been specified and the network configuration file has been uploaded to Azure, you cannot update or add DNS server names or IP addresses once a virtual machine or cloud service has been deployed to the Virtual Network, regardless of whether or not the service is running.

trans-unit.source: The DNS server IP addresses can be changed at any time.
trans-unit.target: The DNS server IP addresses can be changed at any time.

trans-unit.source: Changing DNS server settings requires all Virtual Machines in the virtual networks that are impacted to be rebooted.
trans-unit.target: Changing DNS server settings requires all Virtual Machines in the virtual networks that are impacted to be rebooted.

trans-unit.source: Name resolution may not work if the Virtual Machines do not pick up the updates.
trans-unit.target: Name resolution may not work if the Virtual Machines do not pick up the updates.

trans-unit.source: LocalNetworkSite
trans-unit.target: LocalNetworkSite

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies information about local network sites that are associated with the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Specifies information about local network sites that are associated with the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: You can specify up to 10 local network sites.
trans-unit.target: You can specify up to 10 local network sites.

trans-unit.source: The name of the local network site is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the local network site is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: VPNGatewayAddress
trans-unit.target: VPNGatewayAddress

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the IPsec VPN tunnels between virtual networks and on-premises local network sites.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the IPsec VPN tunnels between virtual networks and on-premises local network sites.

trans-unit.source: To use this element, you must configure a VPN gateway appliance on your local premises (either software or hardware) that can be reached by a public IP address.
trans-unit.target: To use this element, you must configure a VPN gateway appliance on your local premises (either software or hardware) that can be reached by a public IP address.

trans-unit.source: You can specify only 1 public IPv4 address per local network site.
trans-unit.target: You can specify only 1 public IPv4 address per local network site.

trans-unit.source: For more information about supported VPN devices, see <externalLink><linkText>About VPN Devices for Virtual Network</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=248098</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about supported VPN devices, see <externalLink><linkText>About VPN Devices for Virtual Network</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=248098</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: AddressPrefix (LocalNetworkSite)
trans-unit.target: AddressPrefix (LocalNetworkSite)

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the address space that is used for the local network site.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the address space that is used for the local network site.

trans-unit.source: This is the address space of the on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: This is the address space of the on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: The IP address ranges that you specify must not overlap with the IP address ranges of any other local network sites or virtual network sites.
trans-unit.target: The IP address ranges that you specify must not overlap with the IP address ranges of any other local network sites or virtual network sites.

trans-unit.source: Specify the public IPv4 address space per local network site, using CIDR notation.
trans-unit.target: Specify the public IPv4 address space per local network site, using CIDR notation.

trans-unit.source: VirtualNetworkSite
trans-unit.target: VirtualNetworkSite

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the definition of a virtual network site.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the definition of a virtual network site.

trans-unit.source: You can define up to 10 virtual network sites per subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can define up to 10 virtual network sites per subscription.

trans-unit.source: The name of the virtual network site is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the virtual network site is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: To specify a virtual network, you must also know the affinity group or region that you want the virtual network sites to be associated with.
trans-unit.target: To specify a virtual network, you must also know the affinity group or region that you want the virtual network sites to be associated with.

trans-unit.source: When using an affinity group, the affinity group must be created prior to uploading this configuration file.
trans-unit.target: When using an affinity group, the affinity group must be created prior to uploading this configuration file.

trans-unit.source: The affinity group is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>AffinityGroup</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The affinity group is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>AffinityGroup</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: The region is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>Location</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The region is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>Location</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>AffinityGroup</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Location</languageKeyword> can be defined, but not both.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>AffinityGroup</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Location</languageKeyword> can be defined, but not both.

trans-unit.source: Gateway
trans-unit.target: Gateway

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the gateway that is used for cross-premises connectivity from the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the gateway that is used for cross-premises connectivity from the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: The size of the gateway is defined by a string for <languageKeyword>profile</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The size of the gateway is defined by a string for <languageKeyword>profile</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: The profile value must be <languageKeyword>Small</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The profile value must be <languageKeyword>Small</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: AddressPrefix
trans-unit.target: AddressPrefix

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the address space that is used for VPN clients.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the address space that is used for VPN clients.

trans-unit.source: Address prefixes specified in this section must be non-overlapping with other address prefixes and cannot be a subset of the virtual network’s address space.
trans-unit.target: Address prefixes specified in this section must be non-overlapping with other address prefixes and cannot be a subset of the virtual network’s address space.

trans-unit.source: You can specify more than one address prefix.
trans-unit.target: You can specify more than one address prefix.

trans-unit.source: LocalNetworkSiteRef
trans-unit.target: LocalNetworkSiteRef

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the external network sites to connect to.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the external network sites to connect to.

trans-unit.source: Up to 10 reference sites can be added.
trans-unit.target: Up to 10 reference sites can be added.

trans-unit.source: reference site is allowed.
trans-unit.target: reference site is allowed.

trans-unit.source: Any site that you reference must be defined in the <languageKeyword>LocalNetworkSite</languageKeyword> element of this configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Any site that you reference must be defined in the <languageKeyword>LocalNetworkSite</languageKeyword> element of this configuration file.

trans-unit.source: The name of the site is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the site is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: Connection
trans-unit.target: Connection

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of local network site.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the type of local network site.

trans-unit.source: The type of connection is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>type</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The type of connection is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>type</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: VirtualNetworkSiteRef
trans-unit.target: VirtualNetworkSiteRef

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a virtual network that can communicate with the virtual network site.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a virtual network that can communicate with the virtual network site.

trans-unit.source: Any Virtual Network that you reference must be defined in the VirtualNetworkSite element of this configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Any Virtual Network that you reference must be defined in the VirtualNetworkSite element of this configuration file.

trans-unit.source: DnsServerRef
trans-unit.target: DnsServerRef

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the DNS servers that are used for name resolution in the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the DNS servers that are used for name resolution in the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: You must reference the DNS servers that are specified in <languageKeyword>Dns</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: You must reference the DNS servers that are specified in <languageKeyword>Dns</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The name of the DNS server is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the DNS server is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: Azure will be set as the default DNS service for the virtual network if you do not specify any DNS servers.
trans-unit.target: Azure will be set as the default DNS service for the virtual network if you do not specify any DNS servers.

trans-unit.source: If you choose not to specify DNS servers in this section, name resolution will not work across a VPN link.
trans-unit.target: If you choose not to specify DNS servers in this section, name resolution will not work across a VPN link.

trans-unit.source: You can specify up to 9 DNS servers.
trans-unit.target: You can specify up to 9 DNS servers.

trans-unit.source: Subnet
trans-unit.target: Subnet

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the subnets within the address space of the virtual network sites.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the subnets within the address space of the virtual network sites.

trans-unit.source: The name of the subnet is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the subnet is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: You can define multiple subnets for each virtual network site that you create.
trans-unit.target: You can define multiple subnets for each virtual network site that you create.

trans-unit.source: The IP addresses of the subnets you specify must be fully contained within the IP address range for the Virtual Network it resides in.
trans-unit.target: The IP addresses of the subnets you specify must be fully contained within the IP address range for the Virtual Network it resides in.

trans-unit.source: Subnet address spaces must not overlap within the Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: Subnet address spaces must not overlap within the Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: AddressPrefix (Subnet)
trans-unit.target: AddressPrefix (Subnet)

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the address space that is used for subnets.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the address space that is used for subnets.

trans-unit.source: Address prefixes specified in this section must be non-overlapping with other address prefixes and cannot be a subset of the virtual network’s address space.
trans-unit.target: Address prefixes specified in this section must be non-overlapping with other address prefixes and cannot be a subset of the virtual network’s address space.

trans-unit.source: You can specify more than one address prefix.
trans-unit.target: You can specify more than one address prefix.

trans-unit.source: AddressPrefix (VirtualNetworkSite)
trans-unit.target: AddressPrefix (VirtualNetworkSite)

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the address space that is used for virtual network sites.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the address space that is used for virtual network sites.

trans-unit.source: Address prefixes specified in this section must be non-overlapping with other address prefixes and cannot be a subset of the virtual network’s address space.
trans-unit.target: Address prefixes specified in this section must be non-overlapping with other address prefixes and cannot be a subset of the virtual network’s address space.

trans-unit.source: You can specify more than one address prefix.
trans-unit.target: You can specify more than one address prefix.
